definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: Therefore silk is known as "second-skin body" of reputation.
sentences.chinese: 因而蠶絲素有“人體第二肌膚”之美譽。

sentences.english: Zhangzhou enjoys a reputation of "A Land of Flowers and Fruits".
sentences.chinese: 漳州素有“花果之鄉”的美譽。

sentences.english: Hot money is notoriously unstable and even more notoriously procyclical.
sentences.chinese: 熱錢素有不穩定的惡名，名聲更差的是其順週期性。

sentences.english: The higher education from tests the test to be known as "the first under heaven to test" the fine reputation.
sentences.chinese: 高等教育自考考試素有“天下第一考”之美譽。

sentences.english: And therefore Jiaxiang has garned a good fame:the land of Lu Brocade.
sentences.chinese: 因而，嘉祥素有“魯錦之鄉”的美譽。

sentences.english: Xiamen Island, where Xiamen University is located, is known as "a Garden on the Sea".
sentences.chinese: 廈門大學所在的廈門島素有“海上花園”之稱。

sentences.english: Markets have a way of undoing economic decrees.
sentences.chinese: 各金融市場素有抵消經濟政令影響的習慣。

sentences.english: Cotton is one of the Chaoyang specialty known as "Beyond the Great Yin-hua, " said.
sentences.chinese: 棉花是朝陽的特產之一，素有“塞外銀花”之稱。

sentences.english: Shiwan is the pottery capital of southern China with a history as long as Chinese civilization.
sentences.chinese: 石灣鎮，歷史悠久，素有“南國陶都”的美譽。

sentences.english: The two peoples have the tradition of helping and supporting each other.
sentences.chinese: 中智兩國人民素有守望相助的傳統。

sentences.english: The lacquer industry deals with a natural resinous varnish, which is always acknowledged as the "King of Coating."
sentences.chinese: 漆業是天然樹脂塗料，素有“塗料之王”的美譽。

sentences.english: Hengshui since ancient times, rich brush, known as "brush the Holy Land" of.
sentences.chinese: 衡水自古盛產毛筆，素有“毛筆聖地”之稱。

sentences.english: But it is all a grandiose pageant.
sentences.chinese: 但素有這些這都是一種浮誇的盛裝遊行。

sentences.english: Sichuan has always enjoyed the reputation of the being “Heavenly Land of Plenty”.
sentences.chinese: 四川素有“天府之國”的美稱。

sentences.english: Turks and Caicos have built a reputation as an offshore financial center. Paul Adams reports.
sentences.chinese: 特克斯和凱科斯羣島素有離岸金融中心的美譽。

sentences.english: Scholar-officials in ancient China had bias on managing financial affaires.
sentences.chinese: 古代中國的士大夫，在“理財”方面素有偏見。

definition: to dub with a nice-sounding appellation/fanciful moniker
to be famous far and wide (idiom)
to acclaim/to sing the praises of
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
seasoned/honed to perfection over centuries/special reserve
to be located at/to be situated in
